SearchResultWithQuestionPrepended.jsonResult: {"_type": "SearchResponse", "queryContext": {"originalQuery": "What is the name of the scientific process that turns sugars into alcohol? Photosynthesis"}, "webPages": {"webSearchUrl": "https:\/\/www.bing.com\/search?q=What+is+the+name+of+the+scientific+process+that+turns+sugars+into+alcohol%3f+Photosynthesis", "totalEstimatedMatches": 462000, "value": [{"id": "https:\/\/api.cognitive.microsoft.com\/api\/v7\/#WebPages.0", "name": "Photosynthesis - Wikipedia", "url": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Photosynthesis", "about": [{"name": "Photosynthesis"}, {"name": "Photosynthesis"}], "isFamilyFriendly": true, "displayUrl": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Photosynthesis", "snippet": "... which are synthesized from carbon dioxide and water – hence the name photosynthesis, ... into sugars in a process ... they turn back into CO 2 very ...", "deepLinks": [{"name": "Overview", "url": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Photosynthesis#Overview", "snippet": "Photosynthetic organisms are photoautotrophs, which means that they are able to synthesize food directly from carbon dioxide and water using energy from light. However, not all organisms that use light as a source of energy carry out photosynthesis; photoheterotrophs use organic compounds, rather than carbon dioxide, as a source of carbon. In plants, algae, and cyanobacteria, photosynthesis releases oxygen. This is called oxygenic photosynthesis and is by far the most common type of photosynthes"}, {"name": "Photosynthetic membranes and organelles", "url": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Photosynthesis#Photosynthetic_membranes_and_organelles", "snippet": "In photosynthetic bacteria, the proteins that gather light for photosynthesis are embedded in cell membranes. In its simplest form, this involves the membrane surrounding the cell itself. However, the membrane may be tightly folded into cylindrical sheets called thylakoids, or bunched up into round vesicles called intracytoplasmic membranes.
